title: Windows 10 updates and league.
body: So we all remember the horrid windows anniversary update and how it stopped us from playing league. I had uninstalled the update and continued playing, but windows kept bugging me to install updates, until today when it force installed them. I was scared so i started league and ran a custom game, same problem. Is there any permanent fix for this? the xbox game dvr thing is off, or any way to prevent them from updating my windows 10?

replies.body:
I know we've tried to help out in the past, and it's a bummer that there's still issues.  Hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can take a closer look.  We'll help get this figured out!

Also, download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to get a set of logs, and attach it to your ticket for context!

Porocles, do you know if there is a way to schedule or disable the updates to Windows 10?  I'm referring to the ones where it force shuts-down/restart updates the computer without any warning.  The OP, myself, and many others would be super grateful.

-LostFr0st
Theres no way to disable the updates, not without maybe windows 10 pro but since I never bought that I didn't follow it.

Nah, I just ended up restricting the times when it can force-update.
That way it will for sure not interrupt my games.

Have you tried running it with Admin? There is a launcher buried in the folder, Should be something like ThisPc:C:/Riot Games/Legend of Legends/ lol.launcher.admin It's what i've been using since it fixed my issues, however if you don't have the admin account password that could be a bit hard to do.

I'm not sure, my own PC just let's me shut down and update whenever I want so there may be a setting.  You may want to look through[ microsoft support](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us) to check out options best fit for you.  Since it's not technically a league related issue, I don't think it would be a good idea disabling these options which can provide security updates.  :P  Hope that helps!

K thanks, found what I wanted under the "active hours" setting.
Won't restart b/w those times now :)
